Squamous cell carcinoma of the larynx.context: Squamous cell carcinoma of the larynx. Total laryngectomy, right level 2, 3, 4 neck dissection, tracheoesophageal puncture, cricopharyngeal myotomy, right thyroid lobectomy.

58-year-old.context: A 58-year-old gentleman who has had a history of a T3 squamous cell carcinoma of his glottic larynx having elected to undergo a laser excision procedure in late 06/07.

T3 squamous cell carcinoma.context: A 58-year-old gentleman who has had a history of a T3 squamous cell carcinoma of his glottic larynx having elected to undergo a laser excision procedure in late 06/07.

laser excision procedure.context: A 58-year-old gentleman who has had a history of a T3 squamous cell carcinoma of his glottic larynx having elected to undergo a laser excision procedure in late 06/07.

biopsy confirmed tumor persistence.context: Subsequently, biopsy confirmed tumor persistence in the right glottic region.

cartilaginous invasion.context: Also concerned for a CT scan finding of possible cartilaginous invasion at the cricoid level.

total laryngectomy.context: Risks included, but were not limited to anesthesia, bleeding, infection, injury of the nerves including lower lip weakness, tongue weakness, tongue numbness, shoulder weakness, need for physical therapy, possibility of total laryngectomy, possibility of inability to speak or swallow, difficulty eating, wound care issues, failure to heal, need for additional treatment, and the patient understood all of these issues and they wished to proceed.

right level 2, 3, 4 neck dissection.context: Total laryngectomy, right level 2, 3, 4 neck dissection, tracheoesophageal puncture, cricopharyngeal myotomy, right thyroid lobectomy.

tracheoesophageal puncture.context: Subsequently, a tracheoesophageal puncture site was performed using a right-angled hemostat at about approximately 1 cm from the posterior tracheal wall superior aspect.

cricopharyngeal myotomy.context: Total laryngectomy, right level 2, 3, 4 neck dissection, tracheoesophageal puncture, cricopharyngeal myotomy, right thyroid lobectomy.

right thyroid lobectomy.context: Total laryngectomy, right level 2, 3, 4 neck dissection, tracheoesophageal puncture, cricopharyngeal myotomy, right thyroid lobectomy.

anesthesia.context: Risks included, but were not limited to anesthesia, bleeding, infection, injury of the nerves including lower lip weakness, tongue weakness, tongue numbness, shoulder weakness, need for physical therapy, possibility of total laryngectomy, possibility of inability to speak or swallow, difficulty eating, wound care issues, failure to heal, need for additional treatment, and the patient understood all of these issues and they wished to proceed.

inability to speak or swallow.context: Risks included, but were not limited to anesthesia, bleeding, infection, injury of the nerves including lower lip weakness, tongue weakness, tongue numbness, shoulder weakness, need for physical therapy, possibility of total laryngectomy, possibility of inability to speak or swallow, difficulty eating, wound care issues, failure to heal, need for additional treatment, and the patient understood all of these issues and they wished to proceed.

difficulty eating.context: Risks included, but were not limited to anesthesia, bleeding, infection, injury of the nerves including lower lip weakness, tongue weakness, tongue numbness, shoulder weakness, need for physical therapy, possibility of total laryngectomy, possibility of inability to speak or swallow, difficulty eating, wound care issues, failure to heal, need for additional treatment, and the patient understood all of these issues and they wished to proceed.

need for additional treatment.context: Risks included, but were not limited to anesthesia, bleeding, infection, injury of the nerves including lower lip weakness, tongue weakness, tongue numbness, shoulder weakness, need for physical therapy, possibility of total laryngectomy, possibility of inability to speak or swallow, difficulty eating, wound care issues, failure to heal, need for additional treatment, and the patient understood all of these issues and they wished to proceed.

supine.context: After identifying the patient, the patient was placed supine on the operating room table.

oral endotracheal intubation.context: After the establishment of the general anesthesia via oral endotracheal intubation, the patient had his eyes protected with Tegaderm.

Tegaderm.context: After the establishment of the general anesthesia via oral endotracheal intubation, the patient had his eyes protected with Tegaderm.

endoscope.context: A 0-degree endoscope was used to take pictures of what was apparently a recurrence of tumor along the right true vocal fold extending into the anterior arytenoid area and extending about 1 cm below into the subglottis.

tumor recurrence.context: A 0-degree endoscope was used to take pictures of what was apparently a recurrence of tumor along the right true vocal fold extending into the anterior arytenoid area and extending about 1 cm below into the subglottis.

true vocal fold.context: A 0-degree endoscope was used to take pictures of what was apparently a recurrence of tumor along the right true vocal fold extending into the anterior arytenoid area and extending about 1 cm below into the subglottis.

anterior arytenoid area.context: A 0-degree endoscope was used to take pictures of what was apparently a recurrence of tumor along the right true vocal fold extending into the anterior arytenoid area and extending about 1 cm below into the subglottis.

subglottis.context: A 0-degree endoscope was used to take pictures of what was apparently a recurrence of tumor along the right true vocal fold extending into the anterior arytenoid area and extending about 1 cm below into the subglottis.

hematoma.context: Subsequently, a decision was then made to go ahead and perform the surgical intervention.

hemi-apron incision.context: A hemi-apron incision was employed, and 1% lidocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine was injected.

lidocaine.context: A hemi-apron incision was employed, and 1% lidocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine was injected.

epinephrine.context: A hemi-apron incision was employed, and 1% lidocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine was injected.

shoulder roll.context: A shoulder roll was applied after the patient was prepped and draped in a sterile fashion.

subplatysmal flaps.context: Subplatysmal flaps were raised at the hyoid bone into the clavicle.

hyoid bone.context: Subplatysmal flaps were raised at the hyoid bone into the clavicle.

clavicle.context: Subplatysmal flaps were raised at the hyoid bone into the clavicle.

level 2, 3, 4 neck dissection.context: Attention was then turned to the right side, where a level 2, 3, 4 neck dissection was performed.

submandibular fascia.context: Submandibular fascia was appreciated inferiorly along the submandibular gland, this was incised allowing for identification of the digastric muscle.

submandibular gland.context: Submandibular fascia was appreciated inferiorly along the submandibular gland, this was incised allowing for identification of the digastric muscle.

digastric muscle.context: Submandibular fascia was appreciated inferiorly along the submandibular gland, this was incised allowing for identification of the digastric muscle.

digastric tunnel.context: Digastric tunnel was performed posteriorly to the level of the sternocleidomastoid muscle.

sternocleidomastoid muscle.context: Digastric tunnel was performed posteriorly to the level of the sternocleidomastoid muscle.

cranial nerve XI.context: The fascia along the sternocleidomastoid muscle was then dissected along the anterior aspect until the cranial nerve XI was identified.

phrenic nerve.context: Preservation of the phrenic nerve was obtained by identification, and subsequently cross-clamping fibrofatty tissue and lymph nodes just adjacent to the jugular vein inferiorly at level 4.

jugular vein.context: Preservation of the phrenic nerve was obtained by identification, and subsequently cross-clamping fibrofatty tissue and lymph nodes just adjacent to the jugular vein inferiorly at level 4.

hypoglossal nerve.context: The specimen was then mobilized over the internal jugular vein with preservation of hypoglossal nerve.

internal jugular vein.context: The specimen was then mobilized over the internal jugular vein with preservation of hypoglossal nerve.

trachea.context: The trachea was identified in the midline.

thyroid isthmus.context: The thyroid isthmus was plicated using the Harmonic scalpel.

Harmonic scalpel.context: The thyroid isthmus was plicated using the Harmonic scalpel.

cricothyroid joint.context: The cricothyroid joint was then freed on the left side and then on the right side with noting on the right side that this cartilage was a bit more irregular.

cricothyrotomy.context: Upon performing this, it was obvious that there was tumor just above the level of the cricothyrotomy incision.

anode tube.context: A #7 anode tube was then placed in this area and secured.

laryngotomy.context: Subsequently, the cuts were made on the left side with visualization of the vocalis process and coming down to the level of the cricoid cartilage, and the thyroid cartilage was then intentionally fractured along the anterior spine.

vocalis process.context: Subsequently, the cuts were made on the left side with visualization of the vocalis process and coming down to the level of the cricoid cartilage, and the thyroid cartilage was then intentionally fractured along the anterior spine.

cricoid cartilage.context: Subsequently, the cuts were made on the left side with visualization of the vocalis process and coming down to the level of the cricoid cartilage, and the thyroid cartilage was then intentionally fractured along the anterior spine.

thyroid cartilage.context: Subsequently, the cuts were made on the left side with visualization of the vocalis process and coming down to the level of the cricoid cartilage, and the thyroid cartilage was then intentionally fractured along the anterior spine.

anterior spine.context: Subsequently, the cuts were made on the left side with visualization of the vocalis process and coming down to the level of the cricoid cartilage, and the thyroid cartilage was then intentionally fractured along the anterior spine.

cartilage invasion.context: It was evident that this tumor had extended more than 1 cm into the subglottic region.

subglottic region.context: It was evident that this tumor had extended more than 1 cm into the subglottic region.

cricoid cartilage invasion.context: It was evident that the cricoid cartilage was invaded.

tracheoesophageal puncture site.context: Subsequently, a tracheoesophageal puncture site was performed using a right-angled hemostat at about approximately 1 cm from the posterior tracheal wall superior aspect.

running 3-0 canal stitch.context: Once this was performed, a running 3-0 canal stitch was used to close the pharynx.
